member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Cake.ConnectionFactory.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Cake.ConnectionFactory.My.Resources.Resources.CONNECTION_EXCEPTION_FORMAT
P:Cake.ConnectionFactory.My.Resources.Resources.CONNECTION_INCORRECT_DATABASE_STRUCTURE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Database error The database does not have the RQS database structure, please use a database backup from the website http://www.reusecompany.com or a Microsoft Access database included in the installation pack..

member.name: P:Cake.ConnectionFactory.My.Resources.Resources.CONNECTION_VALID_BUT_EMPTY_DATABASE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Database data error The database does not have any ontology information. Please connect to this database with knowledgeMANAGER to store the initial ontology information..

member.name: T:Cake.ConnectionFactory.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: M:Cake.ConnectionFactory.CakeOleDbConnection.TranslateISNULL(System.Data.IDbCommand@)
member.summary: Replaces the SQL Server syntax "ISNULL(MetricPerTypeId, 0)" into the MS Access one "IIF(ISNULL(MetricPerTypeId), 0)"

member.name: M:Cake.ConnectionFactory.CakeOleDbConnection.TranslateISNULL_Private(System.String@)
member.summary: Replaces the SQL Server syntax "ISNULL(MetricPerTypeId, 0)" into the MS Access one "IIF(ISNULL(MetricPerTypeId), 0)"

member.name: M:Cake.ConnectionFactory.CakeOleDbOracleConnection.GetBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Transforms the input string got from the Oracle database in the NCLOB column into a Byte Array ( Byte() )
member.param: Input string got from the Oracle database in the NCLOB column
member.returns: The byte array got after converting the Oracle database in the NCLOB column in a suitable byte array
member.remarks:
To be IMPROVED because we do a manual conversion from what we have in the input string to the byte Array, with these methods Encoding.UTF7.GetBytes(str) Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes(str) Encoding.Unicode.GetBytes(str) Encoding.UTF32.GetBytes(str)
doesn't return the input byte() what we have stored in the Save() Function
